intro: Anemone halleri var. bohemica, commonly known as Bohemian anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring basal leaves that are palmately lobed and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces showy white or pale pink flowers with a distinctive central yellow stamen, which bloom in early spring. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. This variant is distinguished by its slightly smaller flowers and more compact growth compared to other Anemone species.
